doc.str: A method of activating a zeolite membrane comprising a step of placing the membrane in contact with a fluid mixture containing ozone, wherein when the fluid mixture is a gaseous mixture, the fluid mixture has a temperature of at least 423K, and wherein when the fluid mixture is a liquid mixture, the fluid mixture has a temperature of 353K.

O. Pachtova et al, "A Comparative Study of Template Removal From Silicalite-1 Crystals in Pyrolytic and Oxidizing Regimes," Microporous and Mesoporous Materials 55 (2002), Elsevier Science B.V., pp. 285-296. cited by other . | Joseph Lik Hang Chau et al, "Zeolite Microtunnels and Microchunnels," Chem Commun. 2002, pp. 960-961. cited by other . | Yu Shan Susanna Wan et al, "TS-1 Zeolite Microengineered Reactors for 1-Pentene Epoxidation," Chem Commun. 2002, pp. 878-879. cited by other . | Joseph Lik Hang Chau et al, "Incorporating Zeolites in Microchemical Systems," Chemical Engineering Journal 88 (2002), Elsevier Science B.V., pp. 187-200. cited by other . | Junhang Dong et al, "Template-Removal-Associated Microstructural Development of Porous-Ceramic-Supported MFI Zeolite Membranes," Microporous and Mesoporous Materials 34 (2000), Elsevier Science B.V., pp. 241-253. cited by other . | Katherine H. Gilbert et al, "The Effect of Heating Rate and Gas Atmosphere on Template Decomposition in Silicalite-1," Ind. Eng. Chem. Res. 2001, 40, American Chemical Society, pp. 4844-4849. cited by other. | Yu Shan Susanna Wan et al, "Design and Fabrication of Zeolite-Based Microreactors and Membrane Microseparators," Microporous and Mesoporous Materials 42 (2001), Elsevier Science B.V., pp. 157-175. cited by other . | Imre Kiricsi et al, "The Advantages of Ozone Treatment in the Preparation of Tubular Silica Structures," Applied Catalysis A: General 2003 (2000), Elsevier Science B.V., L1-L4. cited by other .
